questions.question_text: Which of the following is defined by TOGAF as a representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
data view(we called it diagram) in company, security view, operation view, overal concept view etc
Correct answer : D
Correct Answer : D

Selected Answer: D
3.17 Architecture View
A representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns.
Note:
In some sections of this standard, the term "view" is used as a synonym for "architecture view".
See also 3.72 Stakeholder and 3.18 Architecture Viewpoint .

Selected Answer: D
31.1 Basic Concepts

An "architecture view" is a representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns. It consists of one or more architecture models of the system.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap31.html

Selected Answer: D
D. View

Selected Answer: B
Correct Answer

Architecture View
A representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns.
Correct Answer

Architecture View
A representation of a system from the perspective of a related set of concerns.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap03.html

Selected Answer: A
There are six parts to this document:
PART I
(Introduction) This part provides a high-level introduction to the key concepts of Enterprise Architecture and in particular the TOGAF approach. It contains the definitions of terms used throughout this standard.
PART II
(Architecture Development Method) This part is the core of the TOGAF framework. It describes the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM) - a step-by-step approach to developing an Enterprise Architecture.
PART III
(ADM Guidelines & Techniques) This part contains a collection of guidelines and techniques available for use in applying the TOGAF approach and the TOGAF ADM. Additional guidelines and techniques are available in the TOGAF Library.
PART IV
(Architecture Content Framework) This part describes the TOGAF content framework, including a structured metamodel for architectural artifacts, the use of re-usable Architecture Building Blocks (ABBs), and an overview of typical architecture deliverables.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap01.html

Selected Answer: A
A. Part I describes the TOGAF approach to Enterprise Architecture
Correct Answer - A , others options are irrelevant

questions.question_text: Which one of the following statements about the structure of the TOGAF 9 document is true?

choices.D: Part IV describes the ADM: a collection of guidelines and techniques used in TOGAF 9
choices.B: Part II describes the definitions of terms used and the changes between versions of TOGAF
choices.A: Part I describes the TOGAF approach to Enterprise Architecture
choices.C: Part III describes requirements management and is considered to be the core of TOGAF

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Page .6
http://www.togaf.info/togaf9/togafSlides9/TOGAF-V9-M2-TOGAF9-Components.pdf

Correct Answer 
Reference : https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/togaf-knowledge-series-3-deliverable-artifacts-building-sanjog-zawar/

choices.B: Artifacts and deliverables are synonymous; there is no difference between them
choices.D: Deliverables are reusable, whereas artifacts are unique to a given architecture project
choices.C: Deliverables are prepared by the Project Manager, whereas artifacts are defined by the Architect
choices.A: An artifact contains one or more deliverables
choices.E: Deliverables are specified as contractual outputs from a project, whereas artifacts are not

questions.question_text: In TOGAF, what is the difference between an artifact and a deliverable?

According to the TOGAF Document Categorization Model, which category describes a technique that is referenced by processes categorized as TOGAF Core and
TOGAF Mandated?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The TOGAF Document Categorization Model specifies that Guidelines and Techniques provide detailed instructions and methods to support the execution of core processes within the ADM. These are referenced by processes categorized as TOGAF Core and TOGAF Mandated.

Relevant Text:
"TOGAF Guidelines and Techniques are categorized as supporting materials used in conjunction with the core ADM to help tailor and adapt the ADM to specific contexts or needs. They include methods that are referenced by TOGAF Core and TOGAF Mandated processes."

Selected Answer: B
2.11 TOGAF Document Categorization Model
• TOGAF Core consists of the fundamental concepts that form the essence of TOGAF.
• TOGAF Mandated consists of the normative parts of the TOGAF specification. These elements of TOGAF are central to its usage and without them the framework would not be recognizably TOGAF. Strong consideration must be given to these elements when applying TOGAF.
• TOGAF Recommended consists of a pool of resources that are specifically referenced in TOGAF as ways in which the TOGAF Core and Mandated processes can be accomplished (e.g., the SEI Architecture Trade-Off Analysis Method or business scenarios).

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf90-doc/arch/chap02.html
Not found in TOGAF 9.2
I thought in TOGAF 9 'The Document Categorization Model' has been removed

questions.question_text: Which of the following reasons best describes why the ADM numbering scheme for versioning output is an example and not mandatory?

choices.C: To enable use with the Architecture Content Framework
choices.A: To show the evolution of deliverables

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
4.2 Architecture Development Cycle
4.2.2 Basic Structure
Note that output is generated throughout the process, and that the output in an early phase may be modified in a later phase. The versioning of output is managed through version numbers. In all cases, the ADM numbering scheme is provided as an example. It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html

Correct Answer -- B 
Reference : https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html
Note that output is generated throughout the process, and that the output in an early phase may be modified in a later phase. The versioning of output is managed through version numbers. In all cases, the ADM numbering scheme is provided as an example. It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization.

Answer: A
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html
In particular, a version numbering convention is used within the ADM to illustrate the evolution of Baseline and Target Architecture Definitions.
